text:
Steps Mix the sugar, soy sauce, ginger and the garlic in a small saucepan.  Thoroughly mix the corn starch and mirin in a small bowl.  Bring the ingredients in the saucepan  Add the mixture in the bowl into the saucepan. Whisk it well. Bring the ingredients to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally.  Reduce the heat and simmer until the mixture forms a glaze on the back of a spoon after it is dipped in quickly. (Approximately four minutes) Let the sauce cool and then drizzle it over your food; e.g. chicken, pork, beef, rice, etc. Quick and Easy Teriyaki Marinate Get your ingredients. 1/2 Cup honey
1/4 Cup gluten-free Soy sauce
fresh grated ginger to taste Pour over your meat and marinate for 1/2 to 2 hours.  Put in the oven and bake as per directions.  Serve.  Alternate Method Ingredients. ½ cup gf soy sauce
¼ cup brown sugar
2 tbsp oil
¼ tsp ground pepper
½ clove garlic
1 tsp dry ginger Mix the ingredients well and set to the side for 20-30 minutes. You want the dry ingredients and wet ingredients to soak up each other. Refrigerate and store unused portion.  Mix well and let set 20-30 minutes. Refrigerate and store unused portion.
